home.subheadline: NZ roasters struggle to access authentic, traceable Brazilian beans. Kafiza connects them directly to farmers — while sharing the deep cultural, historical, and environmental roots of Brazil’s coffee legacy.
home.cta: Join the movement — get early access and be part of reshaping the global coffee supply chain.

about.header: Our Story: A Cultural Bridge Brewed from Data, Heritage & Purpose
about.body:
Kafiza was born from a personal journey — from the coffee-growing soul of Brazil to the specialty roaster scene of New Zealand.

Founded by a Brazilian-born, New Zealand-based tech professional, Kafiza blends deep cultural knowledge with technical skills to solve a global challenge. In Brazil, coffee is more than a crop — it’s a way of life. In New Zealand, roasters are hungry for quality and transparency, yet often lack access to authentic, traceable Brazilian beans.

At the same time, most farmers in Brazil face barriers to reaching international buyers — language, technology, and a lack of visibility in the specialty market.

Kafiza’s mission is twofold:

Globalize the reach of Brazilian coffee culture, beyond the commodity market.

Empower farmers and educate roasters through transparent data, direct relationships, and cultural storytelling.

More than a marketplace, Kafiza is a bridge of trust — where coffee connects people, cultures, and purpose.
